title: Loose Women's Coleen Nolan slams Meghan Markle and Prince Harry
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Loose Women panelist Coleen Nolan has slammed Meghan Markle and Prince Harry for staying in the spotlight after opening up about their emotional battles.

The presenter joined Andrea McLean, Saira Khan and Jane Moore on the ITV show where they discussed the royal’s documentary Harry & Meghan: An African Journey and scenes which saw Meghan admit to struggling at becoming a new mum.

Discussing the emotional film, Andrea commented: ‘There’s going to be naysayers out there…to me she [Meghan] looked so vulnerable.

‘My feelings are you both [Meghan and Harry] need to get away for a while and recover and regroup.’

‘Well, why aren’t they?’ Coleen asked.

Andrea replied: ‘Harry kept calling it a job.’

Harry and Meghan opened up about their battles in the documentary (Picture: Getty)

Coleen snapped: ‘Well change your job. Well if it’s making you that unhappy… why? Why are you doing that? They don’t really have to.’

Luckily for Coleen though, Meghan and Harry have planned a ‘six-week break’ for ‘much-needed family time’.

The couple is expected to press pause on their Royal duties over the Christmas period, with a source telling the Sunday Times that their commitments cease temporarily after mid-November.

Sharing their thoughts on the documentary, Jane revealed that she believed Harry seemed as though he’s in ‘self-destruct mode’ in the documentary and added: ‘I just can’t quite put my finger on it.’

‘I felt uncomfortable witnessing these two people actually having a breakdown,’ Saira said. ‘That’s how I felt.

‘I felt deeply voyeuristic watching it.’

Last week, a clip emerged of Meghan telling presenter Tom Bradby how difficult it has been becoming a mother while living under the glare of the media.

During her 10-day tour of southern Africa alongside Harry she said that it was ‘a very real thing to be going through behind the scenes’.

Meghan even thanked the presenter for asking how she is coping, saying: ‘Not many people have asked if I’m OK.’

Loose Women airs weekdays at 12.30pm on ITV.
